values:
"Beware of false prophets, who come to you in sheep's clothing, but inwardly they are ravenous wolves. You will know them by their fruits. Do men gather grapes from thornbushes or figs from thistles? Even so, every good tree bears good fruit, but a bad tree bears bad fruit. A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor can a bad tree bear good fruit. Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the fire. Therefore by their fruits you will know them. 
                Matthew 7:15-20

Does a hateful person produce love?  Does a liar produce truth?  Does a cold person produce warmth?  What fruits are you producing?  What do you want to produce?

8 Beware lest anyone cheat you through philosophy and empty deceit, according to the tradition of men, according to the basic principles of the world, and not according to Christ. 

Colossians 2:8

A simple test: How do the words of another square with the Bible.  It is a tough test, one that we all fall short of at times but it is the best test I know of.

For I know that my Redeemer lives

That is one of the most powerful statements in the Bible, but it is not spoken by an early Christian or Abraham or one of his descendants.  The thought is something to consider when you are faced with difficult times.  The fact that the speaker doesn't have the right doctrinal pedigree is also a good thing to bear in mind the next time you find yourself looking down on someone whose beliefs don't measure up to your standards.  He was "blameless and upright", and he "feared God and shunned evil".  There is a pretty good standard.

11 If a son asks for bread from any father among you, will he give him a stone? Or if he asks for a fish, will he give him a serpent instead of a fish? 12 Or if he asks for an egg, will he offer him a scorpion? 13 If you then, being evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your heavenly Father give the Holy Spirit to those who ask Him!" 
                                       Luke 11:11-13

Sometimes I have to remind my self that God wants to give good gifts.  He gave us our children, but sometimes we get a challenge that sets us back a bit.  Then I need to come back to scriptures such as this one.  It helps to keep things in perspective, especially when our children are hurting.  Just like Job, I may not understand God's will, I just need to trust and keep going.  I haven't had a challenge yet that didn't turn out well when I've done that.

Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, For they shall be filled.

Matthew 5:6 


We have been going through the church search and I forgot what's most important.  It's not their beliefs about the inerrancy of the Bible, sexual relations outside marriage (heterosexual or homosexual) or infant baptism.  It's about the Father who created us, the Son who saved us and the Spirit who guides us.

But Simon Peter answered Him, "Lord, to whom shall we go? You have the words of eternal life.
John 6:68
I went to one of those early morning sales that are so common on the day after Thanksgiving to try to buy some electronics for presents. I didn't plan very well and so I wasn't able to purchase what I wanted, but it was interesting to see all the people waiting for something. If you're a Christian why not share a smile while you celebrate this wonderful season, and if you're not a Christian click on the scripture and check it out. You won't have to wait in line.

21 And you shall not let any of your descendants pass through the fire to Molech, nor shall you profane the name of your God: I am the Lord.
Leviticus 18:21

This scripture kept running through my mind during the recent elections.  I think embryonic stem cell research qualifies as child sacrifice, but then I got to thinking about other forms of child sacrifice.  We may not destroy children by fire or in the name of research, but how many of us sacrifice our children on the alter of success?  How many of us sacrifice our children on the alter of status?  How many of us sacrifice our children on the alter of material possessions?  How many of us sacrifice our children on the alter of activities?  How many of us sacrifice our children on the alter of permissiveness?

Finally, brethren, whatever things are true, whatever things are noble, whatever things are just, whatever things are pure, whatever things are lovely, whatever things are of good report, if there is any virtue and if there is anything praiseworthy--meditate on these things.
							Phillippians 4:8


So many things I could say about this one, but it stands on its own so I will let it go at that.

So the watchman reported, saying, "He went up to them and is not coming back; and the driving is like the driving of Jehu the son of Nimshi, for he drives furiously!"

								2 Kings 9:20

Can people tell you are a Christian by your driving?  Do you drive like Jehu?  Do you drive by the Golden Rule?  I think it is probably a less than effective witness to cut someone off when you have a fish on your car or speed on the way to church.
